013package org.apache.juneau.bean.openapi3;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.Utils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;

019import java.util.*;
020
021import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
022import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
023
024/**
025 * Configuration details for a supported OAuth Flow.
026 *
027 * <p>
028 * The OAuthFlow Object provides configuration details for a supported OAuth Flow. This object contains the URLs and 
029 * scopes needed to configure a specific OAuth 2.0 flow. Different flows require different combinations of URLs and 
030 * have different security characteristics.
031 *
032 * <h5 class='section'>OpenAPI Specification:</h5>
033 * <p>
034 * The OAuthFlow Object is composed of the following fields:
035 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
036 *    <li><c>authorizationUrl</c> (string) - The authorization URL to be used for this flow. This MUST be in the form of a URL
037 *    <li><c>tokenUrl</c> (string) - The token URL to be used for this flow. This MUST be in the form of a URL
038 *    <li><c>refreshUrl</c> (string) - The URL to be used for obtaining refresh tokens. This MUST be in the form of a URL
039 *    <li><c>scopes</c> (map of strings) - The available scopes for the OAuth2 security scheme. A map between the scope name and a short description for it
040 * </ul>
041 *
042 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
043 * <p class='bcode'>
044 *    <jc>// Construct using SwaggerBuilder.</jc>
045 *    OAuthFlow <jv>x</jv> = <jsm>oauthFlow</jsm>()
046 *       .setAuthorizationUrl(<js>"https://example.com/oauth/authorize"</js>)
047 *       .setTokenUrl(<js>"https://example.com/oauth/token"</js>)
048 *       .setScopes(<jsm>map</jsm>(<js>"read"</js>, <js>"Read access"</js>, <js>"write"</js>, <js>"Write access"</js>));
049 *
050 *    <jc>// Serialize using JsonSerializer.</jc>
051 *    String <jv>json</jv> = Json.<jsm>from</jsm>(<jv>x</jv>);
052 *
053 *    <jc>// Or just use toString() which does the same as above.</jc>
054 *    <jv>json</jv> = <jv>x</jv>.toString();
055 * </p>
056 * <p class='bcode'>
057 *    <jc>// Output</jc>
058 *    {
059 *       <js>"authorizationUrl"</js>: <js>"https://example.com/oauth/authorize"</js>,
060 *       <js>"tokenUrl"</js>: <js>"https://example.com/oauth/token"</js>,
061 *       <js>"scopes"</js>: {
062 *          <js>"read"</js>: <js>"Read access"</js>,
063 *          <js>"write"</js>: <js>"Write access"</js>
064 *       }
065 *    }
066 * </p>
067 *
068 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
069 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.0.0#oauth-flow-object">OpenAPI Specification &gt; OAuth Flow Object</a>
070 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/docs/specification/authentication/oauth2/">OpenAPI OAuth2 Authentication</a>
071 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauBeanOpenApi3">juneau-bean-openapi-v3</a>
072 * </ul>
073 */
074@FluentSetters
075public class OAuthFlow extends OpenApiElement {
076
077   private String authorizationUrl;
078   private String tokenUrl;
079   private String refreshUrl;
080   private Map<String,String> scopes;
081
082
083   /**
084    * Default constructor.
085    */
086   public OAuthFlow() {}
087
088   /**
089    * Copy constructor.
090    *
091    * @param copyFrom The object to copy.
092    */
093   public OAuthFlow(OAuthFlow copyFrom) {
094      super(copyFrom);
095
096      this.authorizationUrl = copyFrom.authorizationUrl;
097      this.tokenUrl = copyFrom.tokenUrl;
098      this.refreshUrl = copyFrom.refreshUrl;
099      this.scopes = copyOf(copyFrom.scopes);
100   }
101
102   /**
103    * Make a deep copy of this object.
104    *
105    * @return A deep copy of this object.
106    */
107   public OAuthFlow copy() {
108      return new OAuthFlow(this);
109   }
110
111   /**
112    * Bean property getter:  <property>operationRef</property>.
113    *
114    * <p>
115    * The identifying name of the contact person/organization.
116    *
117    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
118    */
119   public String getAuthorizationUrl() {
120      return authorizationUrl;
121   }
122
123   /**
124    * Bean property setter:  <property>operationRef</property>.
125    *
126    * <p>
127    * The identifying name of the contact person/organization.
128    *
129    * @param value
130    *    The new value for this property.
131    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
132    * @return This object
133    */
134   public OAuthFlow setAuthorizationUrl(String value) {
135      authorizationUrl = value;
136      return this;
137   }
138
139   /**
140    * Bean property getter:  <property>description</property>.
141    *
142    * <p>
143    * The URL pointing to the contact information.
144    *
145    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
146    */
147   public String getTokenUrl() {
148      return tokenUrl;
149   }
150
151   /**
152    * Bean property setter:  <property>description</property>.
153    * @param value
154    *    The new value for this property.
155    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
156    * @return This object
157    */
158   public OAuthFlow setTokenUrl(String value) {
159      tokenUrl = value;
160      return this;
161   }
162
163   /**
164    * Bean property getter:  <property>externalValue</property>.
165    *
166    * <p>
167    * The email address of the contact person/organization.
168    *
169    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
170    */
171   public String getRefreshUrl() {
172      return refreshUrl;
173   }
174
175   /**
176    * Bean property setter:  <property>externalValue</property>.
177    *
178    * <p>
179    * The email address of the contact person/organization.
180    *
181    * @param value
182    *    The new value for this property.
183    *    <br>MUST be in the format of an email address.
184    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
185    * @return This object
186    */
187   public OAuthFlow setRefreshUrl(String value) {
188      refreshUrl = value;
189      return this;
190   }
191
192   /**
193    * Bean property getter:  <property>examples</property>.
194    *
195    * <p>
196    * An example of the response message.
197    *
198    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
199    */
200   public Map<String,String> getScopes() {
201      return scopes;
202   }
203
204   /**
205    * Bean property setter:  <property>examples</property>.
206    *
207    * <p>
208    * An example of the response message.
209    *
210    * @param value
211    *    The new value for this property.
212    *    <br>Keys must be MIME-type strings.
213    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
214    * @return This object
215    */
216   public OAuthFlow setScopes(Map<String,String> value) {
217      scopes = copyOf(value);
218      return this;
219   }
220
221   /**
222    * Adds a single value to the <property>examples</property> property.
223    *
224    * @param name The mime-type string.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
225    * @param description The example.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
226    * @return This object
227    */
228   public OAuthFlow addScope(String name, String description) {
229      assertArgNotNull("name", name);
230      assertArgNotNull("description", description);
231      scopes = mapBuilder(scopes).sparse().add(name, description).build();
232      return this;
233   }
234
235   // <FluentSetters>
236
237   // </FluentSetters>
238
239   @Override /* OpenApiElement */
240   public <T> T get(String property, Class<T> type) {
241      assertArgNotNull("property", property);
242      return switch (property) {
243         case "refreshUrl" -> toType(getRefreshUrl(), type);
244         case "tokenUrl" -> toType(getTokenUrl(), type);
245         case "authorizationUrl" -> toType(getAuthorizationUrl(), type);
246         case "scopes" -> toType(getScopes(), type);
247         default -> super.get(property, type);
248      };
249   }
250
251   @Override /* OpenApiElement */
252   public OAuthFlow set(String property, Object value) {
253      assertArgNotNull("property", property);
254      return switch (property) {
255         case "authorizationUrl" -> setAuthorizationUrl(Utils.s(value));
256         case "refreshUrl" -> setRefreshUrl(Utils.s(value));
257         case "scopes" -> setScopes(mapBuilder(String.class,String.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
258         case "tokenUrl" -> setTokenUrl(Utils.s(value));
259         default -> {
260            super.set(property, value);
261            yield this;
262         }
263      };
264   }
265
266   @Override /* OpenApiElement */
267   public Set<String> keySet() {
268      var s = setBuilder(String.class)
269         .addIf(authorizationUrl != null, "authorizationUrl")
270         .addIf(refreshUrl != null, "refreshUrl")
271         .addIf(scopes != null, "scopes")
272         .addIf(tokenUrl != null, "tokenUrl")
273         .build();
274      return new MultiSet<>(s, super.keySet());
275   }
276
277   // <FluentSetters>
278
279   @Override /* GENERATED - do not modify */
280   public OAuthFlow strict() {
281      super.strict();
282      return this;
283   }
284
285   @Override /* GENERATED - do not modify */
286   public OAuthFlow strict(Object value) {
287      super.strict(value);
288      return this;
289   }
290
291   // </FluentSetters>
